intro: Englerastrum hutchinsonianum, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker plant, is a member of the Acanthaceae family. It is a shrub characterized by its bright red, tubular flowers that resemble firecrackers, which bloom in clusters. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It is native to Mexico and is adapted to grow in dry, rocky soils. Its unique floral structure and vibrant color make it a striking ornamental plant.
